712675f-a.text:
54-56 West 40th Street, south side, east of 6th Avenue, showing the church structure that is to be replaced with the present Republican Club Building.

Prior to 1902

717903f-a.text:
Bryant Park, looking west from the rear of the New York Public Library, and showing the Park being drastically remodelled, under the Nregime of Park Commissioner Robert Moses. The remarkable thing about this job was the small size of the budget allowed for it and
the results accomplished nonetheless.
April 25, 1934.

709459f.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, north from, but not including West 4Oth., to and including 42nd Streets. Shown on the right, is Bryant Park. Men working, are placing a sheet wall on the western side of said park, to protect underground aqueduct, in preparation for the excavation for
the new Municipal Sixth Ave., subway.
May 6, 1936.
Mr. Schwartz.
New Yomk Public LibrarY.
The same, showing a more inclusive view. Notice the Sixth Ave., Elevated and Station at West 42nd Street. This structure will be shored up during construction of subway and eventually demolished.
May 6, 1936.
Mr. Schwartz.
New York Public Library.

712672f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, from but not including 41st to and including 40th Streets, showing work being started on the new
Sixth Avenue Subway.
April 7, 1936.
New York Public Library.
Schwartz.

717900f-a.text:
Bryant Fark: An eastward view across same, from Sixth Ave. (foreground) between West 40th (right) and 42nd (left) Streets, showing the rear of the Central Building of the New York Public Library which faces on the west side of Fifth Ave., as photographed at dusk (7 P.M.). Across the low roof of the aforementioned educational institution are the spires of the Chrysler, Lincoln, News, Lefcourt-Colonial, New York Trust
Company, and No. 10 East 40th Street Buildings.
March 17, 1938.
Mr. Nathan Schwartz.
New York Public Library.

1558017.title: 1065 Sixth Avenue - West 40th Street
1558017.folder: 1065 Sixth Avenue - West 40th Street, Manhattan, NY

709461f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at W. 40th Street showing one of the last stages oI the Sixth Avenue "El" demolition. Simultaneous with this civic project is the subway construction underground. The latter is eividenced by the temporary wood planking. The photographer is viewing northeastward and towards Bryant Park, the New York Public Library and W. 42nd Street Buildings. Vaguely apparent at the upper right are the Lincoln and the Chrysler
Buildinge.
April 4, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
Neg A I379

709462f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, at W. 40th Street, (right) showing "El" demmolition at this point. The photographer is viewing northeastward and shows across Bryant Park, buildings on the north side of W. 42nd Sereet between this thoroughfare and Fifth Avenue. From left to 1ight these are: Sterns Department Store, the former Aeolian HHIall, the Salmon Tower and No. 500 Fifth Avenue. Nestling beneath the latter is a wing of the New York Public Library.
April 4, 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library

Bryant Park: The snow covered lawn as
viewed westward from the rear nf the New York Public Library. ~Sixth Avenue forms the westerly edge, with West 40th Stre t on the left, and 42nd Street on the right. Note the absence of the Sixth Avenue "El'structure.
December 30, 1939
Nathan Schwartz
New Yor Public Library
Photostat Division
